shared_ptr_helper.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_ARCHIVE_SHARED_PTR_HELPER_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_ARCHIVE_SHARED_PTR_HELPER_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // shared_ptr_helper.hpp: serialization for boost shared pointer
00011

00015 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)

00018 
00019 #include <map>
00020 #include <list>
00021 #include <cstddef> // NULL
00022 
00023 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00024 #include <boost/shared_ptr.hpp>
00025 #include <boost/serialization/type_info_implementation.hpp>
00026 #include <boost/serialization/shared_ptr_132.hpp>
00027 #include <boost/serialization/throw_exception.hpp>
00028 
00029 #include <boost/archive/archive_exception.hpp>
00030 
00031 namespace boost_132 {
00032     template<class T> class shared_ptr;
00033 }
00034 namespace boost {
00035     template<class T> class shared_ptr;
00036     namespace serialization {
00037         class extended_type_info;
00038         template<class Archive, class T>
00039         inline void load(
00040             Archive & ar,
00041             boost::shared_ptr<T> &t,
00042             const unsigned int file_version
00043         );
00044     }
00045 
00046 namespace archive{
00047 namespace detail {
00048 
00049 struct null_deleter {
00050     void operator()(void const *) const {}
00051 };
00052 
00054 // a common class for holding various types of shared pointers
00055 
00056 class shared_ptr_helper {
00057     typedef std::map<const void *, shared_ptr<void> > collection_type;
00058     typedef collection_type::const_iterator iterator_type;
00059     // list of shared_pointers create accessable by raw pointer. This
00060     // is used to "match up" shared pointers loaded at different
00061     // points in the archive. Note, we delay construction until
00062     // it is actually used since this is by default included as
00063     // a "mix-in" even if shared_ptr isn't used.
00064     collection_type * m_pointers;
00065 
00066 #ifdef BOOST_NO_MEMBER_TEMPLATE_FRIENDS
00067 public:
00068 #else
00069     template<class Archive, class T>
00070     friend inline void boost::serialization::load(
00071         Archive & ar,
00072         boost::shared_ptr<T> &t,
00073         const unsigned int file_version
00074     );
00075 #endif
00076 
00077     // list of loaded pointers.  This is used to be sure that the pointers
00078     // stay around long enough to be "matched" with other pointers loaded
00079     // by the same archive.  These are created with a "null_deleter" so that
00080     // when this list is destroyed - the underlaying raw pointers are not
00081     // destroyed.  This has to be done because the pointers are also held by
00082     // new system which is disjoint from this set.  This is implemented
00083     // by a change in load_construct_data below.  It makes this file suitable
00084     // only for loading pointers into a 1.33 or later boost system.
00085     std::list<boost_132::shared_ptr<void> > * m_pointers_132;
00086 
00087     // return a void pointer to the most derived type
00088     template<class T>
00089     const void * object_identifier(T * t) const {
00090         const boost::serialization::extended_type_info * true_type 
00091             = boost::serialization::type_info_implementation<T>::type
00092                 ::get_const_instance().get_derived_extended_type_info(*t);
00093         // note:if this exception is thrown, be sure that derived pointer
00094         // is either registered or exported.
00095         if(NULL == true_type)
00096             boost::serialization::throw_exception(
00097                 boost::archive::archive_exception(
00098                     boost::archive::archive_exception::unregistered_class
00099                 )
00100             );
00101         const boost::serialization::extended_type_info * this_type
00102             = & boost::serialization::type_info_implementation<T>::type
00103                     ::get_const_instance();
00104         const void * vp = void_downcast(
00105             *true_type, 
00106             *this_type, 
00107             static_cast<const void *>(t)
00108         );
00109         return vp;
00110     }
00111 public:
00112     template<class T>
00113     void reset(shared_ptr<T> & s, T * r){
00114         if(NULL == r){
00115             s.reset();
00116             return;
00117         }
00118         // get pointer to the most derived object.  This is effectively
00119         // the object identifer
00120         const void * od = object_identifier(r);
00121 
00122         if(NULL == m_pointers)
00123             m_pointers = new collection_type;
00124 
00125         iterator_type it = m_pointers->find(od);
00126 
00127         if(it == m_pointers->end()){
00128             s.reset(r);
00129             m_pointers->insert(collection_type::value_type(od,s));
00130         }
00131         else{
00132             s = static_pointer_cast<T>((*it).second);
00133         }
00134     }
00135     void append(const boost_132::shared_ptr<void> & t){
00136         if(NULL == m_pointers_132)
00137             m_pointers_132 = new std::list<boost_132::shared_ptr<void> >;
00138         m_pointers_132->push_back(t);
00139     }
00140 public:
00141     shared_ptr_helper() : 
00142         m_pointers(NULL), 
00143         m_pointers_132(NULL)
00144     {}
00145     ~shared_ptr_helper(){
00146         if(NULL != m_pointers)
00147             delete m_pointers;
00148         if(NULL != m_pointers_132)
00149             delete m_pointers_132;
00150     }
00151 };
00152 
00153 } // namespace detail
00154 } // namespace serialization
00155 } // namespace boost
00156 
00157 #endif // BOOST_ARCHIVE_SHARED_PTR_HELPER_HPP
